Definition at line 111 of file CMFormatter.php.

getFormat (  ) 

Return the current formatter.

The format attribute itself is kept private so if in the future format validation is added it won't deprecate anyones code.

Returns:
The complete formatter array.
See also:
setFormat()

$FormatDefault [static]
Initial value:
   array(
    'date' => '',
    'dec' => '.',
    'fixed' => false,
    'mul' => 1.0,
    'post' => '',
    'pre' => '',
    'prec' => 14,
    'sizes' => ' bytes; KB; MB; GB; TB; PB; EB; ZB; YB',
    'thousands' => '',
    'type' => 'string',
    'unit' => 1000
   )

Formatting defaults.

You may change this and it will effect any new CMFormatter objects you create after that point.
